title: Amy Evans (rugby union)
text:
Amy Evans (born 30 September 1990) is a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays <a href="Tighthead%20prop">Tighthead prop</a> for <a href="Skewen%20RFC">Skewen RFC</a> and the <a href="Ospreys%20%28rugby%20union%29">Ospreys</a>. She won her first international cap against <a href="England%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> in 2015.
Early life.
Amy Evans was born on 30 September 1990 in <a href="Aberdare">Aberdare</a>, <a href="Rhondda%20Cynon%20Taf">Rhondda Cynon Taf</a>, Wales. She was diagnosed with <a href="diabetes%20mellitus%20type%201">diabetes mellitus type 1</a> at the age of 11. As a child she was involved in sports, and studied at <a href="Aberdare%20Girls%27%20School">Aberdare Girls' School</a>. While attending Breeze's Gym in Aberdare, Evans began competing internationally in <a href="Olympic%20weightlifting">weightlifting</a>, representing Wales at several events. She worked at the gym as a manager and fitness instructor.
Rugby career.
Evans took up <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> in late 2015, playing for <a href="Skewen%20RFC">Skewen RFC</a>. She became involved in the Wales development programme, and was selected for the <a href="Wales%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales women's national rugby union squad</a> in the <a href="2015%20Women%27s%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2015 Women's Six Nations Championship</a> five months after taking up the sport. She made her debut for the Wales team in the 13–0 victory over <a href="England%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> during the tournament, having come off the bench as a substitute. She was named to the squad once again for the <a href="2016%20Women%27s%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">following Women's Six Nations Championship</a>, while continuing to play for Skewen and the <a href="Ospreys%20%28rugby%20union%29">Ospreys</a>.
